meanings.definition: To churn or agitate milk to separate the butterfat from the buttermilk.
meanings.sent1: She kirned the milk to make butter.
meanings.sent2: The farmer kirned the cream to make homemade butter.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they kirned the milk, pretending to be old-fashioned dairy workers.
meanings.sent4: The storm kirned the ocean, creating frothy waves crashing against the shore.
meanings.sent5: The old-fashioned butter churn kirned loudly in the kitchen, filling the room with a rhythmic sound.

meanings.sent1: He kirned the ingredients together to make a smooth batter.
meanings.sent2: The chef kirned the sauce to ensure all the flavors blended perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The dog kirned the pile of leaves in excitement, scattering them everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The wind kirned the fallen leaves in the park, creating a whirlwind of colors.
meanings.sent5: The DJ kirned the music, creating a lively atmosphere on the dance floor.

meanings.definition: To cause something to become thick or curdled.
meanings.sent1: The heat kirned the milk, turning it into a thick custard.
meanings.sent2: The lemon juice kirned the cream, transforming it into a tangy dessert topping.
meanings.sent3: The potion kirned in the cauldron, emitting a strange odor.
meanings.sent4: The emotions kirned in her heart, making it hard to speak.
meanings.sent5: The magic spell kirned the water, revealing hidden messages written on the surface.
